CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1969, pg. 6 "Organize Black Catholic Knights - Officers of Council 157, Knights of St. Peter Claver, which was organized at St. Brigid's-St. Benedict The Moor Church on a recent Sunday morning, and those who conducted the Installation Rites are pictured above.  Among those in the left photo, reading from left are: Bill Long, trustee of the new council; Leo Evans, inner guard; Dr. Earl Belle Smith, fourth degree Knight of St. Gregory; Father John LaBauve, now of Louisiana, assistant National Chaplain; Martin Davis, treasurer; Willie Kelley of Chicago, Ill., district deputy of Northern States; Msgr. Paul Bassompierre, pastor; Shields Gilmore, of New Orleans, La., National Supreme Knight and Franklin Jerry of Pittsburgh, Grand Knight of the newly organized council...-Harris Photo."Image published by New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, with Bishop Vincent Leonard masked; addition of Bill Long, Leo Evans, Martin Davis, and Msgr. Paul Bassompierre from negative 2001.35.3996.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Knights of St. Peter Claver officers, from left: Dr. Earl Belle Smith, Father John LaBauve, Willie Kelley, Bishop Vincent Leonard, Shields Gilmore, and Franklin Jerry, posed in St. Brigid's-St. Benedict The Moor Church
